verbose_text: On the other hand, a prevalent body of clinical and preclinical evidence implicates a preferential blockade of NMDA receptors on parvalbumin expressing (PV) interneurons as a central mechanism of classical ketamine action, such as increased cortical activity and gamma-band oscillations (GBO) in the 30-80 Hz range [XREF_BIBR - XREF_BIBR].
